SEARCH
Package com.sc2002.view

Class HDBOfficerView

java.lang.Object
com.sc2002.view.HDBOfficerView
public class HDBOfficerView extends Object
Handles the user interface and interactions for users with the HDB Officer role. Provides menu options for viewing projects, managing personal BTO applications (if applicable), registering for project teams, viewing registration status, managing applicant bookings, generating receipts, and handling enquiries for assigned projects.

  • Constructor Details

    • HDBOfficerView

      public HDBOfficerView()
      Default constructor for HDBOfficerView. Initializes view components. Controllers are initialized within the HDBOfficerMenu method using the AppContext.

  • Method Details

    • HDBOfficerMenu

      public void HDBOfficerMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Displays the main menu for the HDB Officer user and handles user input for navigation.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context containing shared resources and state.

    • applyForProjectMenu

      private void applyForProjectMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer applying to a BTO project (as an applicant). Checks eligibility, displays available projects, and processes the application submission.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • viewApplicationStatusMenu

      private void viewApplicationStatusMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer viewing the status of their personal BTO application. Allows the officer (as an applicant) to request withdrawal if the application is in a suitable state.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • generateReceiptMenu

      private void generateReceiptMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer generating and displaying a receipt for their personal successful application.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • submitEnquiryMenu

      private void submitEnquiryMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer submitting an enquiry about a specific BTO project (acting as an applicant). Checks if the officer is currently managing a project.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • viewMyEnquiriesMenu

      private void viewMyEnquiriesMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer viewing, editing, or deleting their personal enquiries (acting as an applicant). Checks if the officer is currently managing a project.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • registerForProjectMenu

      private void registerForProjectMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer registering their interest to join a specific BTO project team.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • viewRegistrationStatusMenu

      private void viewRegistrationStatusMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer viewing the status of their registration request to join a project team. Displays project details if approved.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • viewAndUpdateBookings

      private void viewAndUpdateBookings(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer to view and update bookings for applicants within the project they are managing. Allows booking confirmation and flat type updates.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • generateApplicationReceipt

      private void generateApplicationReceipt(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer to generate a receipt for a specific applicant's application within the project they are managing.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.

    • manageEnquiriesMenu

      private void manageEnquiriesMenu(AppContext appContext)
      Handles the menu flow for an officer to view and reply to enquiries related to the project they are managing.
      Parameters:
      appContext - The application context.
